results.title: High school geography: new insights
results.brief_description: This is a training film to show teachers how to use some parts of the High Schools Geography Project, particularly the “Geography in an urban age” unit. It covers some of the teaching strategies but does not follow through the unit step by step.

results.title: High rolling = High rolling in a hot corvette
results.creator_credit: Igor Auzins, Tim Burstall and Hexagon
results.brief_description: Two friends in North Queensland leave their jobs with a boxing troupe and a shooting gallery and turn to crime. A ‘road movie’ with a soundtrack by the pop group, Sherbet, “High Rolling” set itself firmly in the sunshine and sleaziness of the Queensland coast. Produced on a small budget with an imported American star (Joseph Bottoms), it was the first feature by Melbourne television director, Igor Auzins. Cast also includes Grigor Taylor, Judy Davis and Wendy Hughes.

results.title: High jump and pole vault
results.creator_credit: Ron Taylor and Department of Education, Queensland
results.brief_description: Shows American high jumper Nat Page, demonstrating his own style of the Fosbury flop. Presents the warm up routines, techniques and drills required for progression towards the complete skills.

results.title: High heels
results.creator_credit: Sue Brooks and Victorian Women's Film Unit
results.brief_description: In the 1980’s high heels are back in fashion and women are back in high heels. Why is it feminine to walk in high heels? What does it do to your spine? Does a woman who is helpless need help? What is the appeal of restrictive fashion? And in what way do high heels restrict us? Why do women wear high heels? Written by Alison Tilson.

results.title: High grass circus
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Torben Schioler, Bill Brind, Colin Low and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A ticket to entertainment at the Royal Brothers’ Circus - the only Canadian tent circus in Canada. Filmed during a hectic summer season, with the Big Top up, in transit, or being erected, it vividly captures the 24-hour-a-day brand of circus magic and observes both the men and mechanics behind it. Like the circus itself, it hovers between comedy, sentimentality and the grotesque. An abridged version entitled ‘Little Big Top’ is also available. (Awards: Yorkton, Los Angeles)

results.title: High country children of New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Yvonne MacKay and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Two children - Malcolm and Nerelli Prouting - live with their family on a sheep station in the isolated high country of south New Zealand. This film shows their daily lives from the excitement of mustering high up in the hills to mundane correspondence school work. Filmed on location at Mount Arrowsmith Station, New Zealand.

results.title: Hidden universe: the brain. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Tom Bywaters, American Broadcasting Company and CRM/McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Discusses the cause of aphasia and shows experiments with infants which test their cognitive development and general learning patterns. Also includes a study of visial perception and the advances being made toward giving sight to the blind, as well as looking at a variety of brain malfunctions and current treatment.
